project.name: CDAjs
project.description: CDAjs is a stand-alone javascript library for working with Pentaho Community Data Access plugin.

CDAjs.name: CDAjs
CDAjs.description:
This is CDAjs - a stand-alone javascript library for working with Pentaho plugin "Community Data Access" CDA (Community Data Access) is a open source plugin for Pentaho Business Analysis suite, designed to allow greater flexibility for data sources. Powered by WebDetails.

CDAjs is cross-browser and Node.js compatible and enables web-browser-based analytical Pentaho Business Intelligence applications.
CDAjs.title: CDAjs

CDA.name: CDA
CDA.description:
The CDA class provides a javascript API to communicate Pentaho Community Data Access plugin
(CDA) over HTTP.

params.name: options
params.description: standard options

CDA.Exception.name: CDA.Exception
CDA.Exception.description:
This class is used to indicate an runtime errors occurring in any of the methods of the CDAjs classes.

You do not need to instantiate objects of this class yourself. Rather, instances of this class are created and thrown at runtime whenever an error occurs.

To handle CDAjs errors, you can use a try...catch block like this: 

   try {
       ...general cdajs work...
   } catch (exception) {
       if (exception instanceof CDA.Exception) {
           ...use exception.code, exception.message and exception.data to handle the exception.
       } else {
           ...handle other errors...
       }
   }

params.description: a self instance of CDAjs.

classitems.description:
These are the default options used for new CDA instances in case no custom properties are set. It sets the following properties:
  • REQUEST_TIMEOUT int: 60000 - number of milliseconds before a request to the Pentaho server will timeout
  • ASYNC boolean: true - determines whether synchronous or asynchronous communication with the Pentaho server will be used.
  • ACCEPT string: text/xml, application/json - determines the accept header on http request with the Pentaho server will be used.
  • CONTENT_TYPE string: application/json - determines the content-type header on http request with the Pentaho server will be used.
  • METHOD string: GET - determines the method on http request with the Pentaho server will be used.
classitems.name: DEFAULT_OPTIONS

classitems.description: Can appear as value for the type property of instances of the CDA.Exception class, and indicates that this CDA.Exception signals an error.
classitems.name: TYPE_ERROR

classitems.description: Can appear as value for the type property of instances of the CDA.Exception class, and indicates that this CDA.Exception signals a warning.
classitems.name: TYPE_WARNING

classitems.description: Exception code indicating that missing the CDA URL.
classitems.name: ERROR_CDA_URL_CODE

classitems.description: Exception code indicating that missing options in the constructor.
classitems.name: ERROR_CDA_OPTIONS_CODE

classitems.description:
Exception code indicating a general XMLHttpRequest error. If this error occurs, the data object of the exception will have these members:
  • request: the options that make up the original HTTP request
  • status: the HTTP status code
  • statusText: the HTTP status text
classitems.name: HTTP_ERROR_CODE

classitems.description: Exception code indicating that missing username for Pentaho authentication.
classitems.name: ERROR_CDA_USERNAME_CODE

classitems.description: Exception code indicating that missing password for Pentaho authentication.
classitems.name: ERROR_CDA_PASSWORD_CODE

classitems.description: Exception code indicating that missing data access id for CDA query.
classitems.name: ERROR_MISSING_DATA_ACCESS_ID_CODE

classitems.description: Exception code indicating that missing params object for invoke CDA endpoint.
classitems.name: ERROR_MISSING_PARAMS_CODE

classitems.description: Exception code indicating that missing path property on object params for invoke CDA endpoint.
classitems.name: ERROR_MISSING_PARAMS_PATH_CODE

classitems.description:
This propery indicates what kind of exception occurred. It can have one of the following values:
TYPE_WARNING
Indicates a warning
TYPE_ERROR
Indicates an error
classitems.name: type

classitems.description: A code that can be used to identify this particular kind of exception.
classitems.name: code

classitems.description: A human readable message that describes the nature of the error or warning.
classitems.name: message

classitems.description:
A name that indicates in what component (on the client or server side) this error or warning
occurred.
classitems.name: source

classitems.description: A path or url that points to a document that contains more information about this error.
classitems.name: helpfile

classitems.description:
Additional data captured when the exception was instantiated. The type of information stored
here is dependent upon the nature of the error.
classitems.name: data

classitems.description: A reference to the built-in arguments array of the function that is throwing the exception This can be used to get a "stack trace"
classitems.name: args

classitems.description: Returns a string representing this exception
classitems.name: toString

classitems.description: Get a stack trace.
classitems.name: getStackTrace

return.description: an array of objects describing the function on the stack
